intro: Keteleeria oblonga, commonly known as the Chinese fir, is a coniferous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure typical of the Cupressaceae family. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a conical crown. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against environmental stressors. Keteleeria oblonga is valued for its durable timber and plays an important role in forest ecosystems.
